pull.title: BIP-0374: fix incorrect bit index and modernize CSV reader usage in test vector scripts
pull.body:
- **Corrected a logic bug in `gen_test_vectors.py`**  
  Previously, the message tampering logic mistakenly used the proof damage index (`proof_damage_pos`) instead of the correct message index (`msg_damage_pos`). This could result in ineffective or misleading bit-flip tests.  
  Now fixed to use the correct index for tampering the message.

- **Modernized usage of `csv.reader` in `run_test_vectors.py`**  
  Replaced the outdated `reader.__next__()` with the idiomatic and Python 3â€“safe `next(reader)` call for skipping headers.

labels.name: Pending acceptance
labels.description: This BIP modification requires sign-off by the champion of the BIP being modified

events.body: Pinging BIP authors @andrewtoth, @RubenSomsen and @theStack for feedback.

> Previously, the message tampering logic mistakenly used the proof damage index (proof_damage_pos) instead of the correct message index (msg_damage_pos). This could result in ineffective or misleading bit-flip tests.

Good catch, thanks for fixing (seems I back then copy-and-pasted from the proof damaging above and forgot to adapt the array index :face_with_peeking_eye: )! Note though that we also track the generated test vectors data, so you should run the fixed `gen_test_vectors.py` script and include the re-generated .csv files in the commit.

events.message: Regenerate test vectors after fixing message tampering logic in gen_test_vectors.py

events.body:
@theStack 
Regenerated `test_vectors_*.csv` using the fixed `gen_test_vectors.py` and included them in the commit as requested. Ready for review.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,7 +111,7 @@ def gen_all_verify_proof_vectors(f):
     # modifying message should fail (flip one bit)
     msg_damage_pos = random_scalar_int(idx, "damage_pos") % 256
     msg_damaged = list(msg)
-    msg_damaged[proof_damage_pos // 8] ^= (1 << (msg_damage_pos % 8))
+    msg_damaged[msg_damage_pos // 8] ^= (1 << (msg_damage_pos % 8))
